article.headline: Boston College 76, Rutgers 44
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Jared Dudley scored 10 of his 20 points during a 23-2 second-half run to lead Boston College to a 76-44 victory over Rutgers on Sunday. The Eagles (18-8, 7-6 Big East) made their move after leading scorer Craig Smith went to the bench with four fouls with 15:26 left in the game. BC scored nine consecutive points and then, after a fast break layup by Herve Lamizana, the Eagles scored 14 points in a row -- eight by Dudley -- to make it 61-34. BC scored eight straight late in the game to open a 31-point lead. Nate Doornekamp had 11 points and nine rebounds, and Smith, who never needed to come back into the game, scored 11 for the Eagles. Dudley had eight rebounds. Lamizana had 13 points and eight rebounds for Rutgers (15-9, 6-7) and Ricky Shields went just 3-of-15 from the field, missing all seven 3-point attempts. The Scarlet Knights had won six of their previous eight games but scored just 17 points in the second half while committing 11 turnovers and shooting 6-of-28. The dismal showing damaged Rutgers' chances of its first invitation to the NCAA tournament since 1991. The Scarlet Knights have a chance to pick up three more wins, but none would have been as impressive as one at Boston College. The teams came into the game locked in the middle of the Big East standings with six other teams within one game of .500. With three games left, BC has a chance to win 20 before the conference tournament and solidify its bid for a berth in the NCAA tournament. The Eagles were one of the most surprising omissions from last year's field when they went 19-10. This year, they are much stronger in the power ratings that the selection committee uses to decide on the field.
